title: Wedding lamps

  object_colour: multicoloured

  physical_appearance: This is a wedding lamp and it has a red base
 Its bulb envelope is translucent and there is a big Chinese character in red that is being displayed there. In between the bulb envelope and the red base
 there is golden casing joinging them both. The bulb envelope  is pear-shaped
 meaning that it is wide in the middle and tapers towards the top
 like a pear.

  subject_terms_1: decorations (ornaments) fertility weddings (ceremonies)

  subject_terms_2: Lamps Wedding decorations Beliefs and cultures Marriage customs and rites

  subject_terms_3: Marriage customs

  sgcool_label_text: This pair of wedding lamps was bought and used for a Chinese wedding in Singapore in 1962. In Chinese culture
 wedding lamps were placed at the bed side or vanity table and were intended to bless the couple in their marriage. The lamps have a symbolic meaning of fertility and wealth ().

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a wedding lamp and it has a red base, Its bulb envelope is translucent and there is a big Chinese character in red that is being displayed there. In between the bulb envelope and the red base, there is golden casing joinging them both. The bulb envelope  is pear-shaped, meaning that it is wide in the middle and tapers towards the top, like a pear.

In Chinese culture, wedding lamps were placed at the bed side or vanity table and were intended to bless the couple in their marriage. The lamps have a symbolic meaning of fertility and wealth ().
